test.framework

Class TestClassLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.ClassLoader
      • test.framework.TestClassLoader

  • public class TestClassLoader
extends java.lang.ClassLoader
    A parent last class loader to load the classes under test. This class loader is child first: It assures that any class referenced by a class once loaded with this class loader will be loaded with this class loader. Therefore, a new TestClassLoader assures to provide completly "fresh" classes. Classes can as well be mocked through #mock(MockerJavaClassFile).
    Since:
    24.01.2015
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Joshua Gleitze

      • getResource

        public java.net.URL getResource(java.lang.String name)
        Overrides:
        getResource in class java.lang.ClassLoader

      • mock

        public static void mock(MockerJavaClassFile mocker)
        Replace a class with another one. When a tested class requires mocker.getName(), it will get the implementation provided through mocker.getByteCode().
        If the class is already loaded, it will not be replaced. All future instances of this class loader will use mocker, though. If you are working with TestObject, call TestObject.resetClass() after mocking to make sure the mocker will be loaded.
        To remove mocking, call forget(String).
        Parameters:
        mocker - the MockerJavaClassFile object

      • loadClass

        protected java.lang.Class<?> loadClass(java.lang.String name,
                           boolean resolve)
                                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Overrides:
        loadClass in class java.lang.ClassLoader
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • forget

        public static void forget(java.lang.String className)
        Makes this class loader forget about the bytecode of className. Guarantees that the class will be loaded newly on all future instances of this class loader. Use this method to remove the mocking of classes.
        NOTE: Calling this method will not reset the currently loaded class! If you are working with TestObject, call TestObject.resetClass() after calling forget to make sure the original class will be loaded.
        Parameters:
        className - The full qualified name of the class you want to reset.
